meanings.definition: Move or cause to move at a great speed, typically in a wildly uncontrolled manner.
meanings.sent1: The car will hurtle down the hill.
meanings.sent2: I watched the train hurtle past the station.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to hurtle through the trees for fun.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to hurtle by as we enjoyed the carnival.
meanings.sent5: The rocket will hurtle into space with incredible speed.

meanings.sent1: The hurtle of the waterfall was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent2: We could hear the hurtle of the wind during the storm.
meanings.sent3: The hurtle of the roller coaster made everyone scream with joy.
meanings.sent4: The hurtle of emotions overwhelmed her during the performance.
meanings.sent5: The hurtle of the avalanche was terrifying to witness.
